intro: Batschia vahliana, commonly known as the Vahli's bat's whisker, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky, coastal environments and is adapted to the island's unique climate. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
